tokenized_sentence: the beyond update brought a lot of bugs but even with those this game is a triumph
no mans sky is beautiful peaceful and absorbing
they still do have bugs and some times low fps in worlds with a lot going on but they have a lot now in game for its price and is what everyone wanted in the start just lack of online game play
the grinding which makes up most of the game is not only boring but frustrating due to the completely messed up inventory management
terrible
i avoided fighting starships until i got the best purple exotics in my hold and am constantly scanned and attacked for them
animal variation is better than vegetation slightly
but there are tons of bugs appeared also
terrible
pros quite a bit of variety in creatures planets ships environments etc
also i was a tiny bit annoyed that you have to figure out everything by yourself but i guess thats part of the experience
there are no tall trees like were shows in e3 theyre all saplings

this is true of plants animals minerals buildings caves oceans freighters frigates space stations and i kind of hate to say this because its clear that making any kind of procedural variation is an immense amount of work and this type of creation is still pretty new
all of the monoliths are the same its nothing but a chore to chase them down
terrible

playing this on 2020 and still it doesnt feel like a 2016 game the gameplay and the graphics are great and the grind might be overwhelming for some but the satisfaction of achieving and exploration beats it
stuttering lagging inprecice controls and such just from a technical difficulty
static audio bad fps and i run a high end system

props to hello games for attempting something so massive and complex and they have my full support especially in the face of so much criticism from haters who need a linear storyline and constant ordersobjectives to enjoy a game
